instructions.text:
- To go back to a previous menu, type 'b' or 'back'
    - To exit, type 'exit' or 'quit' 
    - To select a menu item, type all or part of the name of the option - in the case of partial names, the first to match is selected! Look out for secrets!

what is it good for?.text: Python popular for building web servers (Google uses it a lot). It is also very popular for machine-learning, and is flexible enough to develop games with as well.

why is it called python?.text: out of love for monty python!

what is it good for?.text: Javascript is good at being flexible. The language is necessary for front-end web development. It is also commonly used to build servers thanks to NodeJS. Finally, the Unity game engine allows you to use it while developing games

Low-level programming that requires very efficient algorithms and knowledge of computer hardware. Potentially extremely performant. Used to create the Linux Kernel and to program many embedded devices

A web page is made of 3 pieces: html, css, and javascript. HTML is mostly about text. CSS is mostly about style and layout. Javascript is about behaviour. HTML and CSS are necessary for making front-end web applications or even very simple websites.

Bash is a 'shell' to send commands directly to programs or to the operating system. It is the heart of using linux in a terminal and gives incredible control over your system. You can also write sequences of commands into 'scripts' to run them in repeatable ways!
collaborating on code with others as well as providing version control

which to choose?.text: either choose atom, or flip a coin and choose between atom and sublime. Emacs and vim are great, but only learn them if you think its fun to have an extremely customizable, complicated, efficient editors that need some learning to use.

vim.text: type vimtutor into the console with vim installed. If it doesn't work, google it. It is a built-in tutorial that should come with the editor.

what is the linux kernel used for?.text: The linux kernel is used in embedded devices, and is probably running on your TV. It powers Chromebooks, android phones, routers, and almost every server in the world. Its also used as the kernel for desktop operating systems like GNU, ie, Ubuntu, Fedora, etc

why is it called gnu/linux?.text: An operating system has many parts. The GNU organization worked to create an operating system but had no kernel. The Linux kernel had no operating system to embed itself within. Both projects combined to create GNU/Linux, although for brevity some people just call it linux

who is he?.text: the inventor of the linux kernel and current leader of the project

Former MIT nerd who decided that users of software should be able to run their software however they like, should be able to have a copy of the source code, should be able to modify that source code, and should be able to share their modified or unmodified versions. He kick-started the 'free as in freedom' software community and created an operating system and a lot of other software to enable these freedoms

who is saint ignucious?.text: somewhat strangely, he sometimes wears robes and a hat made of an old computer disk to preach about free software and his weird/amazing text editor, Emacs. It is gold

what is a linux distribution?.text: gnu/linux is modular. You combine a kernel with various utilities to read/write files and manage processes, then with a display software like X-org or Wayland, some kernel modules, and some other things. You also provide software repositories where you can find working software for use with this operating system. On top of all of this you also add a desktop-environment, which might be Unity, Gnome, KDE, Mate, xfce, or others.

which to choose?.text: Ubuntu has a very large and friendly community of users and developers. This means that when you go online to find help for a problem, there are a lot of high quality resources you will find.
